markdownRemark.html:
road blocks

inspector kept getting a error ! SyntaxError: expected expression, got '<'

the error was coming from my JS file in my component when attempting to return

found that this was JSX and the reason I was getting this error was becauce I didn't have anything in place to convert the JSX to plain JavaScript code suitable for a browser.

Solution go to react documentation found there was two ways to handle this I chose to add a JSX preprocessor to the project following the steps I was able to load Babel in to the project folder using npm and using npx on the command line to run it.

After doing this was still getting the same error !SyntaxError: expected expression, got '<' going back to the documentation I realized that once the npx command npx babel --watch src --out-dir . --presets react-app/prod is ran babel will watch the .js file that you put in the src directory and from there create a preprocessed version of the .js file with plain JavaScript code suitable for the browser.

I created a src directory and copied the .js file to it, however my mistake was I copied and not moved the file so it appeared that when babel read the .js from the src directory it did not create a preprocced version because a file with the name already existed. When I deleted my orignal .js file it allowed babel to read the src .js file and then create a preprocessed .js file and the magic the browser rendered my compenent as expected.
